oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Daniele Alexander Interview - Biff Collie - Tape 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 2 of 2. Recording of an interview with Daniele Alexander (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Daniele Alexander; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Daniele Alexander talks about writing "First Move" at five am -- (00:30) "First Move" is talked about as Alexander being one of few excited for individual recording -- (00:55) Alexander describes "Fairy tail Fools" with Lisa Graham as one of her favorites -- (01:26) Alexander talks about how she believed she was going to be a pilot -- (01:47) "Silly Me" by Alexander is joked about as it was a story about someone who walked out on her -- (02:30) Biff Collie and Alexander talk about Alexander's family structure and how Alexander didn't plan on singing but being a pilot -- (03:38) Alexander talks about how her father's aviation company went under and how it propelled her to sing -- (04:22) Alexander talks about how she would sing with her father at clubs and it inspired her to continue singing -- (04:57) "Where'd the Moon Go Wrong" by Alexander is talked about -- (5:33) Alexander talks about singing at school and girls changing voices -- (07:14) "Memories" is recalled to be a song wrote while driving in traffic and selling it to someone is Los Angelo's -- (08:18) Alexander talks about he consistent writing and fitting her sound to Nashville -- (08:44) Alexander's "Just a Little too Late" is recalled as another break-up song -- (09:17) "She's There" by Alexander is just described as a spontaneous decision -- (09:55) "I Don't Want to Know" Alexander talks about her success under a time crunch -- (10:25) Bonnie Raitt is talked about as Alexander's favorite singer -- (11:14) Alexander's height (5'9") is addressed and her troubles in youth -- (12:34) Alexander enjoys the message of her "True Heart" track -- (13:10) Collie and Alexander discuss difficulty of relationships -- (14:39) Alexander reflects on as a child hoping to help overseas as a child -- (15:18) "Goodbye to Me" is talked about as about leaving a cheater -- (15:58) Alexander try's her best disc jockey impersonation
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Alexander, Daniele; Collie, Biff;
